channel.title: Client not downloading cache :(
channel.description:
Been searching everywhere, but can't find a fix. When my client starts up, it doesn't download the cache off my dropbox, instead, it returns with an error that says that mapConfig.txt is missing. My cache: [url=https://www.dropbox.com/s/khz8al9bx90rulr/DivineSyndicate.zip]https://www.dropbox.com/s/khz8al9bx90rulr/DivineSyndicate.zip[/url] (i'm using divine syndicate v2 pi source)
skype: [B]emil1000123[/B] i have teamviewer :p
[IMG]http://i.snag.gy/kazwq.jpg[/img]
[B]Update: I noticed the client creates the folder, but there's only a few files in it.[/B]
[IMG]http://i.snag.gy/FEuGI.jpg[/img]

item.title: Client not downloading cache :(
item.dc:creator: @lol_space1 lol space
item.description:
@lol_space1 wrote:

This post is irrelevant to the problem. He needs the cache to auto-download for other players to be able to get on without having to download the cache separately. :palm:

Read full topic

dude its simple just move your original cache to the c driver
and thats it

item.title: Client not downloading cache :(
item.dc:creator: @lol_space1 lol space
item.description:
@lol_space1 wrote:

Okay, well is it because your cache isn’t uploaded to your public folder? Your cache link is incorrect

Read full topic

item.title: Client not downloading cache :(
item.dc:creator: @morot4 morot4
item.description:
@morot4 wrote:

lol space:

Well, as the CMD states, You’re missing the “mapConfig.txt” file in the original cache, sometimes it’s named something else, but goto your cache --> maps and check if it’s in there, if not you can simply add it. or if it has another name, just rename it. Hope this helps, if you’re getting another error just reply.

No, i’m not.
/Maps/mapConfig.txt is not missing in the zip.
also read entire post, it doesnt even download the zip

Read full topic

item.title: Client not downloading cache :(
item.dc:creator: @lol_space1 lol space
item.description:
@lol_space1 wrote:

Well, as the CMD states, You’re missing the “mapConfig.txt” file in the original cache, sometimes it’s named something else, but goto your cache --> maps and check if it’s in there, if not you can simply add it. or if it has another name, just rename it. Hope this helps, if you’re getting another error just reply.

Read full topic
